context: the patient is a 53-year-old male who was seen for evaluation at the request of dr. x regarding recurrent jaw pain.

the patient is a 53-year-old male who was seen for evaluation at the request of dr. x regarding recurrent jaw pain. this patient has been having what he described as numbness and tingling along the jaw, teeth, and tongue.
he had been diagnosed with a throat infection about a week ago and is finishing a course of avelox at this time.
he had been diagnosed with a throat infection about a week ago and is finishing a course of avelox at this time.
he has recently stopped tobacco. he has been chewing tobacco for about 30 years.
he has had a loss of sensation of taste as well.
he does report he has had about a 20-pound of weight gain over the winter, but notes he has had this in the past just simply from decreased activity.
he does note a history of headaches. these are occasional and he gets these within the neck area when they do flare up.
the patient does note he has a history of anxiety disorder as well.
he has tried to eliminate his amount of tobacco and he is actually taking nicorette gum at this time.
past surgical history: pertinent for hernia repair.
family history: pertinent for hypertension.
allergies: he is allergic to codeine, unknown reaction.
general: the patient is an alert, cooperative, obese, 53-year-old male with a normal-sounding voice and good memory.
nasal: reveals a deviated nasal septum to the left, moderate, clear drainage, and no erythema.
ears: both ears, external ears are normal. the ear canals are clean and dry. the drums are intact and mobile. he does have moderate tympanosclerosis noted, no erythema.
neurologic: he does have slightly decreased sensation to the left jaw.
procedure: a fiberoptic nasopharyngoscopy was also performed.
impression: 1. persistent paresthesia of the left manual teeth and tongue, consider possible neoplasm within the mandible.
impression: 3. hypogeusia with loss of taste.
impression: 5. xerostomia.
recommendations: i have ordered a ct of the head.
